answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
The City of Longview, Washington consolidated its Park’s department with the Public Works department.
http://www.mrsc.org/contracts/l65-igpw.pdf
I also found some examples of city departments consolidating with county ones.
The City of Helena, Montana partnered with Lewis and Clark County in 1999.
http://www.ci.helena.mt.us/departments/parks-recreation/advisory-groups/city-county-parks-board.html
This is the Proposed Consolidation Plan between the City of Topeka, Kansas and Shawnee County. 
http://www.topeka.org/pdfs/parks_rec_merger_plan.pdf 
The City of Schertz, Texas partnered with Bexar County, Texas to start the first park system in the area. 
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/303237/Crescent_Bend_Nature_Park
The City of Tacoma, Washington partnered with the Metropolitan Park District of Tacoma to better collaborate on park maintenance.
http://cms.cityoftacoma.org/cityclerk/Files/CityCouncil/Agreements/IntAgr-MetroParks_20081021.pdf
I have also included an ordinance from Kentucky which establishes that two groups can consolidate to maintain a parks department.
http://www.lrc.ky.gov/krs/097-00/035.PDF
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org
